tweets.text:
How many other rivers in England are having vast amounts of raw sewage dumped into them at this very second? "Exceptional circumstance"?

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/8rarB1lphZ

@RussellB1ggs @SEGandrewK @theriverstrust @N_Rivers_Trust I am still surprised that UK maintain all these weirs. "But we need them for flow measurement for flood warning". Well, in Denmark we have exactly ZERO of them and we have no problems measuring flow. Just remove them and get connectivity AND habitat back. Cheap and easy.

The new wetland @CroxtethHall has already attracted some new wildlife! Can‚Äôt wait to see/hear what‚Äôs living there in a years time once it has greened up üòä @EnvAgencyNW @SimonBennettEA @ccnw1 https://t.co/3rRyGITqTt

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

tweets.text:
Our scientists have made a breakthrough in supporting the UK‚Äôs response to #coronavirus.

We can now use sewage samples provided by water companies to detect local outbreaks, even when people don‚Äôt show symptoms.

Read more: https://t.co/VlvDhIA8I9

#CovidSewageTesting #TeamEA https://t.co/rhsdlZLGYE

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Local farm sends slurry runoff down ditch every time it rains.  Eventually ends up in river about a mile away. EA don't want to know.

@prixpics @EnvAgency You mean like this. Sewage been dumped into the Hogsmill River from the Epsom sewage tanks.

https://t.co/7K1RubcNah

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency It‚Äôs not exceptional circumstances, it‚Äôs every time it rains, which in England is a fair bit. @thameswater and other water cos get away with dumping raw sewage because the @EnvAgency which is meant to stop pollution is effing useless, and worse, complicit.

Kitchen roll is one of the top 3 #unflushables people admit to having flushed down the loo. 
 
However, unlike toilet paper it doesn't dissolve and instead causes blockages. 
 
Never flush kitchen roll. 
 
Protect your pipes and our environment.

#Unblocktober #BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/NUg5UumjEq
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Profuse nettle growth beside that outflow pipe indicates high phosphorous area. Nettle thrive in high Phosphorous soil's. That would indicate a continuous problem.

@EnvAgency plans to overhaul its river quality monitoring regime by introducing a new system that monitors water quality at randomly selected sites have been branded a ‚Äúload of rubbish‚Äù by its staff 

https://t.co/s5poEg9JZR

@oliverpitt @EnvAgency Believe it or not but, according to the data I have in front of me, @wessexwater wouldn't win, not even close.

Top of league Division 1. @YorkshireWater with a whopping 616,643 hours worth of sewage dumped into rivers in 2019 followed by @stwater with a hefty 272,518 hours.

@ProbashC @SpPuckeridge KSAKE! How has that not been identified as an immediate need for flood prevention measures? I‚Äôm assuming that the relevant agencies are still arguing the toss over who is responsible and those residents at imminent risk of flooding will just have to rely on a few sandbags again?

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Last night I drove through flooding from Ewell to Purley then Warlingham. I thought I would ruin my car it was so deep in places. I imagine storm drains overwhelmed then sewers so local rivers taking the brunt.
